newsitem.title: DUBAI: Middle East, Asian gold demand soars - WGC.
newsitem.headline: Middle East, Asian gold demand soars - WGC.

text.p: A slide in bullion prices has fanned Middle East and Asian gold demand higher, an official at the World Gold Council (WGC) was reported as saying on Thursday.

"The demand for gold is soaring not only in the Middle East but in Asian countries such as India and Pakistan," Rolf Schneebeli, Dubai-based WGC chief executive for Middle East and India told the UAE Gulf Today newspaper.
"The price drop has been driven by speculation and the physical market is soaking up all supply," Schneebeli said.
Dubai is the second largest redistributor of gold after Singapore, importing 350 tonnes of gold in 1996, and is the main supplier to India, which is the world's largest gold consumer.
Traders in the Gulf emirate this month have reported a strong upturn in wholesale and retail business as prices fell below a key psychological level of $350 an ounce.
Gold was trading at $344.10-$344.40 on Thursday, its lowest level for three years.
